name: Pilot - Learn English with Ricky Gervais

transcript.content: Hello, and welcome to learn English with Ricky Gervais.
I'm Ricky Gervais... With me, Karl Pilkington...
Alrite.

I won't be speaking your language. I won't be translating what I say. I'll just be speaking English. Okay. The translation will come up on the bottom of the screen... This is my friend, Karl Pilkington. He is bald... He is bald... He has no hair... Karl Pilkington has no hair.
Yeah, I know. They can see I've got no hair.
No, I know.
What do they need to know that for? If they're learnin' a language. Bald isn't, a, a bald head isn't, isn't that important. Teach them how to ask for bread or milk.
We'll get to that. But this is about, sort of, friendship and family, you know? So it's all useful. There's so many words, you know, they might as well start somewhere.
There's too many words. A lot of words... Lot of words.
So you say it, Karl Pilkington is bald... Karl Pilkington, has got a head like a fucking orange.
Right, I really don't know why they need to learn this.
Because they might need to say that one day.

No, but I get enough abuse now, from english people, I don't want Chinese suddenly turning up going, "bald fucking orange". Teach them how to say milk, I need milk. Milk for tea, coffee. Teach me useful stuff.
Okay, well, go and teach them something then.
Who am I talking to?
People around the world. They can't speak English yet. So what are they?
Well, Chinese. Chinese are the ones that-
Well doesn't (stammers), okay. What?
I've been to China, and none of them know English.
Right?
So, they need to learn English.
Okay
So, umm... What would they want to know? You see, they don't need to know about milk, because they don't like milk. They think English people smell of milk. They smell of milk.
Ricky laughs
Smell.
What does smell mean, Karl?
Smell. Umm, stink. Fucking hell. You smell. Rank.
(Laughs) Rank! Rank. So you've got a chinese fella, he's coming over here and he's learned the word rank, meaning you stink.
Smell. Stank, stunk.
Ricky laughs
That stunk.
Give an example.
Umm... You smell, you shit.
Ricky laughs
Why are you teaching them pidgin English?
Karl laughs
Because she told me, you said they want to know about smell.

Yeah. Right. But why are you teaching them without prepositions and proper gr-, why are you teaching them to speak like this? "Mmm. Stink. You shit?" Why are you teaching them to speak li-, just speak proper English.
Right. Okay then.
Always speak proper English. Okay. Tell them.
Um, so what. What do they want to know?
Well, what. What does smell mean?
So we're featuring the word smell. Smell.
This is about the word smell.
Right, when something smells. They know what it means. It's when something stinks. When it's off.
Well no, it doesn't always mean that, cus it's also a verb.
Alrite, a nice smell.
It's also a verb, to smell. It's a verb. Smell is a verb.
Yes, but what they've got to remember is if they go up to someone and go, "you smell", it's not always positive. You wouldn't. you say you smell nice.
Right?
But if you say "you smell", they'll get a smack in the face.
Smack in the face. Smack in the face. Karl, what's a smack in the face?
When someone thumps you, thump.
Ricky laughs
This is the worst english lesson ever. Right, okay. (Stammers) Okay.
What would they wanna, let, you see- That's why we've got a focus on. Are we focusing on Chinese?
No.
Well, we should, because different people want different things.
Right.
So what would Chinese want? They come to England, right? What do they want?
Why are you talking to me like I can't understand English now?
Because I'm trying to think how, what, to be clear to them.
Okay.
So I'm dropping out-
So forget where they come from, wherever they come from in the world. They all want the same things.

No, but. But words don't mean the same thing. It's certain places. There's people where it stinks in the world, they wouldn't come to England and need to say, it smells because they're from a smellier place.
No, they're not.
Yes, they are.
Ricky makes a strange noise
Milk. Let's do milk.
Okay. Let's do milk for anyone who isn't English. Okay. Okay, I'll, um. Okay. We will act out a scenario now where you might need milk. Okay. Okay. Hello, Karl.
Alrite
Would you like a cup of tea?
Yeah.
Yes, please.
Yes, please. Ahh, strong. What tea bags have you got?
Ricky laughs
That is a- That is a, that is a question I ask, because it all depends on the amount of milk. Do you have typhoo? That means more milk.
(Laughing) Typhoo does not mean more milk.
No, it's a very strong tea bag. Right, twinings? Little bit.
This isn't. They don't need to know the details, this isn't a travel guide. This is just. This is English for people who can't speak en-
Right, start again then. Start again then.
Okay. Hello, Karl, are you. Would you like a cup of tea?
I'd love one. I'm gasping.
How do you like it?
Strong, no sugar.
Tea bag, Okay?
What?
Ricky makes a noise
Yeah. Teabag, yeah.
Right, that should be alright.
Would you like some milk?
Just a drop. A drop. Not much.
Would you like semi skimmed milk?
Yeah
Semi skimmed milk.
Woah.
It's alrite that.

Karl is enjoying his tea. He had it strong, with a drop of milk. So, that's the basics. In England, we like to drink tea. We drink tea. We also drink coffee, we also drink beer. Let's go shopping. So I'll just come into a shop, okay. Dring.
Afternoon.
Hello.
Howya.
I want a fish.
What sort of fish do you want? We got loads.
What sort of fish are there?
Loads. I haven't got time, to be honest. You've come in at a busy time. Have a look and come back to me.
I don't know What. What type of fish is this?
That's a, uhh, kipper.
Okay, a kipper. What's a kipper?
Chinese and Japanese know fish really well. They don't need...

Okay, stop thinking we're just talking to Chinese and Japanese. I don't know where the Japanese came. It was just chinese people. This is for anyone who wants to learn English anywhere around the world. There might be Spanish, there might be French, there might be German. Okay? Why do you only care about the Chinese learning about this?

Because most spanish people can speak English. They've been taught it, but alright, kipper, it's a fish. It's sort of umm, a fishy sort of fish. There's some fish that's more meaty, tuna. What sort of thing are you after today? Is this for you or for someone else?
This is for me. I'd like to buy a fish, please.
Right, but you've-, but surely you know what kipper is? Look at it. Look at the fish. Here it's called kipper. Where are you from?
...I don't speak English.
I'd just wrap any old shit up and give it ya.
Ricky laughs

You'll like this. Tenner. Rip you off. Because I'm busy, and that's what happens in this country. That's what they want to be careful of if they're watching this, if you're coming to England, don't be ripped off. Rip off. Conned. Taken advantage of.
Done up like a kipper.
Done up like a kipper.
Look at this foreigner. I done him up like a kipper.

This is when English gets complicated, because kipper, a lot of english words can mean many things. Where? Wear? Same word, different thing. Wearing. Where have you been? I'm wearing a jumper. Where have you been? Where?
Brilliant.
One word, two meanings.
At the spa. Hello, I'd like to book an appointment for a treatment.
Okay. When are you... When are you thinking? We're busy all today. Tomorrow.
Can we just do it today? Can it just be available now? Can't we just do it that it's available now? There's nothing, it- it's-
Well alright, I can fit you in. Someone hasn't turned up yet. So we can get you in, sort of, in ten minutes.
Okay. Right. Okay.
What would you like?
I would like, a back crack and sack waxing, please. I would like my back waxed, my crack waxed and my sack waxed.
Right.
Do you do the treatments yourself?
No.
I'd like you to.
Well, I can't.
Why not?
Because I have to be on reception taking calls.
Well, okay.
You can't request who's doing your sack, your crack or your back.
Ricky laughs
There's a woman in the back who does your crack.
Well, um.
Karl and Ricky laugh
This is fucking insane. Right, that's enough for me. I don't know what we're doing here. I don't know who's going to learn anything from this.
No, fuck off. Wait, wait, wait, wait. Okay. Okay, right. Okay. Okay. Well, ask me some questions about, okay.
Well, I don't have to ask any questions. I said you can go in in ten minutes. I'm not doing it, I'm working. I'm not paid or qualified to do sorting your arse out.

Wait. Okay. Wait, wait. Okay. Actually, thinking about it, the hair on my crack hasn't grown back, nor has the hair on my back, but my sack is very hairy. Wait. My sack is very hairy, um. I don't need my back waxed or my crack waxed, but I need my sack waxed.

(laughing) Right now. I'm surprised you haven't done it yourself, because it's the back and the crack that's the difficult bit. The sack, you can do yourself. To be honest, it should all be growing at the same time.
No.
So there's something wrong with you. You've got a hairy bollock, when your back is lovely and bald.
Right.
You don't need it doing.
Bald. Bald. My back is bald. My crack is bald. My sack needs waxing.
Right.
It's quite an emergency. My balls are very hairy. Can I have them waxed, please?
Yes.
How much? Just for the balls?
15 pounds. for the both.
15 pounds. For two. Okay, that's good. So 7.5 each. It's seven fifty-
Yeah, but we don't split it. That's, that's the price.
Yes.
You can't have one done. Its fifteen pounds.
No, I have two. I have two balls. I have two balls. How many balls do you have, Karl?
Two.
Karl has two balls. Are your balls hairy?
Average.

Okay. Which is strange because Karl's balls are hairy. But he is bald on his head. His head looks like a ball. His head looks like a bald testicle. Karl has a head like a bald testicle, but his testicles aren't bald... Okay. How long will it take to whack my balls?
Ten minutes. Ten minutes.
Ricky laughs
Okay. Okay. So it's, um, 15 pounds and ten minutes. Can you do it? Can you, can you do it now, please?
No, I won't be doing it. You'll be meeting Leslie in the back room.
Oh, I don't really. I'm a little bit...shy. I know you. Could you-
You don't know me. You've just turned up.
Could you wax my balls?
No, I'm not waxing your balls, bollocks, uhh. Scrotum. Uhhm, what else is there? Testi. If you're having one done, bollocks. Sack. What else is there?
Okay, okay. We've done that, Waxing, okay. At the doctor's. Hello, doctor.
Hello.
I have a pain.
Okay, what's, whereabouts is the pain?
My anus.
Of course it is.
Both laugh
None of this is worth use, learning in a language. You go home if you're ill. Go home.
No. If a foreign fella is in this country
He can go to the doctors and use our sys-, our NHS system. If he had an achy arse, he'd get on the first flight home. Why aren't you going travelling? You're here as a tourist?
Yes.
Right, well see London. Instead of worrying about your 'airy bollocks. See the London Eye. The London Eye. Tower of London. These are things that are going to be useful to them.
Okay.
Tower of London, London Eye, Buckingham palace, the Queen... I've never been on holiday and had to have my anus seen to.
Ricky laughs
I haven't seen to whilst I'm here, at home. Give them useful words. Fromage.
Why are you teaching them a french word if we're teaching them English?
I'm just saying useful phrases.
Right.
I've got headache.
Okay, what would you do? Okay, what scenario would you do to teach them now? Teach you a useful scenario?
Yeah. Who are you?
Anyone you want me to be. What do you want to do?
The bins haven't been emptied.
Who? Okay.
Who are you?
You're making this scenario up, this is your-
So who are you, then? The council.
It's up to you.
Right, you're my neighbour.
Okay.
Why do you keep putting bins out? The bin men doesn't come till Thursday. You keep putting bins out.

(Old man voice) I'm sorry, Karl, I'm very sorry. I've had a bit of trouble. I woke up this morning, it's the worst it's ever been. I have got a distended. I've got a prolapsed rectum. Distended. My testicles are very, very low. Cause I'm old. I'm lactating.
Yeah, all right, listen, can you just put the bins out on a Thursday?
I can't do that.
Put your bin.
My balls are so low cause I'm an old man.

But can you put the bins out on a Thur-, the bin men doesn't come till a Thursday, it's Tuesday, you're putting bins out too early, these foxes getting at them, there's shit all over the place. There's dirty underpants you keep putting in the bin. I've told you, it attracts foxes. Stop putting the fucking bins out thue-, two fucking days early, when they've got to sit then it attracts-, I'm try ta sell me flats. There's dirty shitty undies all over the fucking pavement.
(Regular voice) This has happened to you, hasn't it?
Yeah, it has. Yeah.
Does it really? What did you do?
They don't give a shit. They don't give a shit.
We hope that's been useful for you, so when you visit England, you can talk just like an Englishman. Thank you for learning English with Ricky Gervais and Karl Pilkington.
See ya.
See ya.
